alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 3:59PM CDT until June 05 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. .Heavy rainfall expected today and Wednesday will cause the river levels to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From Friday morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 34.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CDT.
